japanese: ほとんどの報道機関は交渉の成果について、進展はあったものの時間切れで物別れに終わったと報じた。
english: Most press reported the negotiations failed to produce an agreement although major progress was made, as time ran out.

japanese: 一方、全国紙の一社だけが夕刊に日米交渉は実質合意に至ったという見出しを掲げて、政府関係者を含め多くの人を驚かせた。
english: Meanwhile, one national newspaper put out a headline in its evening edition, which read Japan and the U.S. came to a substantial agreement. This surprised many people including the government officials.

japanese: トムのこと嫌いな人なんていないと思う。
english: I don't think there's anyone who hates Tom.

japanese: トムはメアリーに話せなかった。どうすることもできなかった。
english: Tom couldn't talk to Mary and there was nothing he could do about it.

japanese: 「僕、バカだな〜」「そんなことないよ」
english: "I'm an idiot." "No, you're not."

japanese: メアリーはネイルサロンで働いてるのよ。
english: Mary works at a nail salon.

japanese: この問題を解決するのは簡単ではなかった。
english: It wasn't easy to solve this problem.

japanese: 幸せそうだったわ。
english: He looked happy.

japanese: これは私の絵の写真です。
english: This is a picture of my drawing.

japanese: このケーキ誰が焼いたの？
english: Who baked this cake?

japanese: この家は空き家です。
english: This house is vacant.

japanese: 言わぬに越したことはない。
english: Some things are better left unsaid.

japanese: 言わぬが花よ。
english: Some things are better left unsaid.

japanese: それはどうやって発音するのですか？
english: How is that pronounced?

japanese: 来週お時間があるようなら、お知らせください。
english: Let us know if you're available next week.

japanese: トムのパーティーはどうでしたか。
english: How was Tom's party?

japanese: 神様はどこにでもいるよ。
english: God is everywhere.

japanese: ブラジル料理って、食べてみたことある？
english: Have you ever tried Brazilian food?

japanese: 日焼け止め塗った？
english: Did you put on sunscreen?

japanese: あ、日焼け止め塗ってくるの忘れた。
english: Ah, I forgot to apply sunscreen.

japanese: 社会人になっても何らかの形で音楽は続けたいと思ってます。
english: Even after I get a job, I think I'll still want to continue some form of music.

japanese: ソチオリンピックの頃、コブクロのテーマ曲が流行りました。きっとみんな聞いたことがあると思います。でも、もう３ヶ月経ちました。最近、この曲を聞くことはないですよね。
english: During the Sochi Olympics, the theme song by Kobukuro was a big hit. I'm sure everyone has heard it. However, it has already been three months. We do not hear the song anymore, do we?

japanese: こんにちは！私の名前は、マリアです。２３歳、ベルリンから来ました。
english: Hello! My name is Maria. I'm 23 years old and I come from Berlin.

japanese: このセーター、首のところがチクチクする。
english: This sweater irritates my neck.

japanese: 自分の作った例文がさまざまな言語に訳されて、間接的に他の言語の学習者の役にも立つことになるというのが、タトエバの醍醐味の一つです。
english: The most satisfying thing about Tatoeba is that the sentences I've written have been translated into several languages and are indirectly useful to students of other languages.

japanese: 昨日のパーティーなんで来なかったの？
english: Why didn't you come to yesterday's party?

japanese: 奥様とご結婚されたのはいつですか？
english: When did you marry your wife?

japanese: 簡単な曲なら初見で歌えます。
english: If it's a simple tune, I can sight-sing it.

japanese: 運動会の写真、どこのフォルダに入れた？
english: Which folder did you put the photos from the sports festival into?

japanese: 僕がなんでここにいるか知っているの？
english: Do you know why I'm here?

japanese: 俺がなぜここに居るか分かってる？
english: Do you know why I'm here?

japanese: オーストラリアの物価がそんなに高いなんて知らなかった。
english: I didn't realize that the cost of living was so high in Australia.

japanese: 音大生はみんな初見とか即興とか得意なの？
english: Can all university music students do things like sight reading and improvisation?

japanese: 忙しくなるよ。
english: It’s gonna get busy!

japanese: 今日は火曜日です。
english: Today is Tuesday.

japanese: 今日は火曜です。
english: Today is Tuesday.

japanese: 天気はどうなるの？
english: What will the weather be like?

japanese: こちらでよろしいでしょうか。
english: Will that be all?

japanese: ガリレオ・ガリレイって本名？
english: Galileo Galilei's real name?

japanese: 子供は苦手なんだ。
english: I'm not good with kids.

japanese: 子供の扱いが苦手なんだ。
english: I'm not good with kids.

japanese: 誰だよ、こんな幼稚な記事書いたの。
english: Who wrote such an unrefined article?

japanese: トムの仕事の仕方はとても几帳面だ。
english: Tom is very methodical in the way he does his work.

japanese: そのブラウス、ピッタリじゃん。
english: That blouse fits you well.

japanese: その大学には食堂があるよ。
english: There is a cafeteria in the university.

japanese: 今日の空は雲に覆われている。
english: The sky is covered with clouds today.

japanese: このソファー座り心地が悪いな。
english: This couch is not comfortable.

japanese: この傘いくらですか？
english: How much does this umbrella cost?

japanese: またサーバー落ちてる。
english: The server is down again.

japanese: この海岸は、夜は危険です。
english: This beach is dangerous at night.

japanese: このビーチは、夜は危ないよ。
english: This beach is dangerous at night.

japanese: もちろん、一緒に行くよ。
english: Of course we'll go with you.

japanese: 日曜は入場無料です。
english: Admission is free on Sundays.

japanese: 牡蠣って食べたことある？
english: Have you ever eaten oysters?

japanese: 新しい家具を買いました。
english: We bought new furniture.

japanese: 新品の家具を買いました。
english: We bought new furniture.

japanese: めっちゃ曇ってるね。雨になるだろうね。
english: It's very cloudy. I think it's going to rain.

japanese: 彼が突然、私の前に現れたのよ。
english: He suddenly appeared in front of me.

japanese: 彼がいきなり、目の前に出てきたの。
english: He suddenly appeared in front of me.

japanese: 彼らは先週来た。
english: They came last week.

japanese: あの人たちは先週来てたよ。
english: They came last week.

japanese: 警察に尾行されてる。
english: The police are following us.

japanese: 刑事につけられてる。
english: The police are following us.

japanese: フランスンの文化省の仕事を探しています。
english: I am looking for a job with the Ministry of Culture of France.

japanese: 彼女が自転車を貸してくれたんだよ。
english: She lent me her bicycle.

japanese: ご厚意に感謝いたします。
english: I thank you for your kindness.

japanese: 朝食は８時からです。
english: Breakfast is served at eight o'clock.

japanese: 太郎は高校入ってからテストで100点取ったことある？
english: Have you ever gotten a perfect score on a test in high school, Taro?

japanese: トムはかわいいって言われるの嫌？
english: Tom, would you hate being called cute?

japanese: この文、トムだったらどう訳す？
english: How would you translate this sentence, Tom?

japanese: 2分でいいので話聞いてもらえませんか？
english: If you have a couple minutes, could you hear me out?

japanese: そんなのよくあることだから気にしなくていいよ。
english: That happens often, so don't worry about it.

japanese: 5cmでいいからその身長分けてほしいわ。
english: I wish you could give me some of your height, even if only 5 cm.

japanese: 何があったの？ 話せる範囲でいいから話してくれない？
english: What happened? Can you tell me as much as possible?

japanese: フランスのパリから来ました。
english: I'm from Paris, France.

japanese: フランスのパリ出身です。
english: I'm from Paris, France.

japanese: 彼氏が嫉妬深くて困ってます。
english: My boyfriend's jealousy is causing me difficulty.

japanese: 「ねえ、なんでそんなにかっこいいの？」「生まれつきだよ」
english: "Come on, howd'ya get that stylie?" "I was born with it!"

japanese: そんなにトムが好きなら私と別れてトムと付き合えば？
english: If you like Tom so much, why not break up with me and date him?

japanese: 一回電源落としてみたら？
english: Try to power cycle it?

japanese: 警察に相談してみたら？
english: Why not try talking to the police?

japanese: 市と町の違いは何？
english: What is the difference between 'city' and 'town'?

japanese: 別に失恋が好きなわけじゃないけど、失恋ソングはすごく好きなんだよね。
english: It's not that I particularly love heartbreak, but I really like songs about heartbreak.

japanese: 最後にトムを見かけたのはボストンだった。
english: The last time I saw Tom was in Boston.

japanese: 最後にトムに会ったのはボストンだった。
english: The last time I saw Tom was in Boston.

japanese: あなたも新しく入った方ですか？
english: Are you new, too?

japanese: それ、新しいネクタイ？
english: Is that a new tie?

japanese: それ、新しい車？
english: Is that a new car?

japanese: それって新車？
english: Is that a new car?

japanese: それって、新しいシャツ？
english: Is that a new shirt?

japanese: それって新しいジャケット？
english: Is that a new jacket?

japanese: それって新しい上着？
english: Is that a new jacket?

japanese: あれがあなたの新しい本？
english: Is that your new book?

japanese: それ、新しい香水？
english: Is that a new perfume?

japanese: 新しい先生ですか？
english: Are you the new teacher?

japanese: それ、新しい水着なの？
english: Is that a new bathing suit?

japanese: 新しい企画を考えましょう。
english: Let's come up with a new plan.

japanese: 新しい友達の名前は何？
english: What is your new friend's name?

japanese: トムは新しいコンピューターを購入する予定だ。
english: Tom is going to buy a new computer.

japanese: あの新しいレストラン、どう思う？
english: What do you think of that new restaurant?

japanese: これは、ドラム式洗濯機です。
english: This is a front-loading washing machine.

japanese: ちょっと待って。靴ひもほどけた。
english: Wait a second. My shoe is untied.

japanese: 俺だけ？
english: Am I the only one?

japanese: 仕事を再開する前に少し休養を取ることにした。
english: Before going back to work, I decided to rest a little.

japanese: 兄は熱狂的なサッカーファンだ。
english: My older brother is a very enthusiastic soccer fan.

japanese: 大雨のせいで予定がすっかり狂ってしまった。
english: Due to the rain, my plans were completely mixed up.

japanese: 生まれ変わったらヴァイオリン習いたい。
english: If I were reborn, I would want to learn the violin.

japanese: フランス語で「こんにちは」って何て言うんですか？
english: How do you say "hello" in French?

japanese: 何ページ？
english: What page?

japanese: どこに鍵を置いたの？
english: Where did you put your key?

japanese: 君どうしちゃったの？
english: What has become of you?

japanese: メアリーは熱々のコーヒーが好きだけど、トムはぬるめが好きなんだ。
english: Mary likes her coffee steaming hot, while Tom likes his lukewarm.

japanese: 私が食べた飴、美味しかったよ。
english: The sweets I ate were delicious!

japanese: 太ってはないよ。ちょっと、ぽっちゃりしてるだけで。
english: She's not fat – she's just a little plump.

japanese: 彼女は苦痛に悶え苦しんでいた。
english: She was in agony.

japanese: 近くにスーパーはありますか？
english: Is there a supermarket nearby?

japanese: ちょうど着いたばかり。まだスーツケースから荷物を出してもいない。
english: I've just arrived. I haven't even emptied my suitcases yet.

japanese: 踵が痛い。
english: I have a sore heel.

japanese: 私が知る男は、みんな車が好き！
english: All of the men that I know like cars!

japanese: 先お風呂入っていいよ。
english: You can use the bath before me.

japanese: それは当局の関知するところではない。
english: That's not our business.

japanese: 俺らの知ったことか。
english: That's not our business.

japanese: 私らには関係ないことよ。
english: That's not our business.

japanese: 私は整備士です。
english: I am a mechanic.

japanese: 生活習慣病の定義は何ですか？
english: What is the definition of lifestyle disease?

japanese: こんな鳴き声の鳥、オーストラリアにもいる？
english: Are there birds with this kind of chirp in Australia too?

japanese: 「ねえメアリー」「なに？」「メアリーって彼氏いるの？」「なんで？」
english: "Hey, Mary." "What?" "Do you have a boyfriend?" "Why?"

japanese: トムとはどうやって知り合ったの？
english: How did you meet Tom?
